author: Coral Barry
title: Virgil van Dijk targets Chelsea transfer as Southampton begin search for replacement
text:
Virgil van Dijk wants to join Chelsea (Picture: Getty) Virgil van Dijk has reportedly decided he wants to move to Chelsea this summer prompting Southampton to make up a list of replacements for the defender.
Marco Verratti reveals the club he would happily leave PSG for Liverpool centre-back Mamadou Sakho is thought to be at the top of their wishlist after he completes his loan deal with Crystal Palace.
Van Dijk is rated at around £50 million by Southampton who are hopeful a transfer bidding war might erupt between Manchester City and Chelsea.
Chelsea fixtures Crystal Palace (H) – Sat 1 Apr
Manchester City (H) – Wed 5 Apr
Bournemouth (A) – Sat 8 Apr
Manchester United (A) – Sun 16 Apr
Tottenham (N) FA Cup – Sat 22 Apr
Everton (A) – Sun 30 Apr
Middlesbrough (H) – Sat 6 May
West Brom (A) – Sat 13 May
The Telegraph claim Van Dijk has the pick of any top club in the Premier League, but is leaning towards joining the champions-elect.
Antonio Conte is set to continue with a back three in the new season and believes Van Dijk can fit into the system with ease.
Mamadou Sakho is set to leave Liverpool this summer (Picture: Getty) More: Football Thierry Henry loves Kylian Mbappe but says he must do one more thing to be star 
Picture: Man Utd star wearing leg brace after picking up injury on international duty 
Video: Chelsea youngster RUINS team-mates with CLASS goal in training 
The 25-year-old is comfortable on the ball and is one of the most powerful defenders in the top flight.
Southampton believe Van Dijk’s skills will demand a record fee for a Premier League defender.
City paid £47.5 million for John Stones last summer and the Saints want upwards of that amount for Van Dijk.
